channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Cl0p Implicated in Oracle Zero-Day Attacks, Breaching UPenn and University of Phoenix
item.description:
The University of Pennsylvania and the University of Phoenix have both reported data breaches resulting from the exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities in their Oracle E-Business Suite servers. The attacks have compromised the personal information of at least 1,488 individuals at UPenn and a much ...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: WhatsApp Worm Spreads Astaroth Banking Trojan in New Brazilian Campaign
item.description:
A new malware campaign, tracked as STAC3150, is targeting banking users in Brazil by using WhatsApp Web as a distribution vector for the Astaroth banking trojan. The attack begins with a social engineering lure sent via WhatsApp, which persuades the victim to download a malicious ZIP archive. The ar...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: SharePoint Flaw Chain Exploited to Deploy Warlock Ransomware
item.description:
A new attack campaign attributed to the threat actor Storm-2603 is exploiting a chain of Microsoft SharePoint vulnerabilities (CVE-2025-49706, CVE-2025-49704) for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deploy Velociraptor, a legitimate digital forensics and incident response (DFIR) tool, f...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Vulnerability, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Malicious Go Packages Impersonating Google UUID Library Steal Data
item.description:
A sophisticated and long-running supply chain attack targeting Go developers has been discovered, active since at least May 2021. The attack involves two malicious packages, `github.com/bpoorman/uuid` and `github.com/bpoorman/uid`, which impersonate a popular Google UUID library using a typosquattin...

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Exposes 'BRICKSTORM' Backdoor Used by Chinese State Actors to Infiltrate US Government
item.description:
The US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA), NSA, and Canadian Centre for Cyber Security have jointly exposed a sophisticated backdoor named 'BRICKSTORM'. According to the December 4, 2025 advisory, People's Republic of China (PRC) state-sponsored actors are using this malware to ...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

item.title: Under Armour Sued Over Data Breach Attributed to 'Everest' Cybercrime Group
item.description:
Athletic apparel giant Under Armour is the target of a new class action lawsuit following a November 2025 data breach. The suit, reported on December 4, 2025, claims the company was negligent in protecting the personal information of consumers and employees. The breach was allegedly carried out by t...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: ValleyRAT Malware Targets Job Seekers Using Foxit PDF Reader Disguise
item.description:
A new malware campaign is distributing the ValleyRAT remote access trojan by preying on job seekers. Attackers send emails with weaponized executables disguised as HR documents, using the Foxit PDF Reader icon as a lure. The attack leverages a legitimate, renamed Foxit executable to perform a DLL si...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Malware, Phishing, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Cryptomixer' Shut Down: Authorities Seize €25M in Bitcoin from Laundering Service
item.description:
A coordinated international law enforcement action, codenamed "Operation Olympia," has successfully dismantled Cryptomixer.io, a major cryptocurrency mixing service. Led by Swiss and German authorities with significant support from Europol and Eurojust, the takedown resulted in the seizure of server...

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Cyberattack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran-Linked MuddyWater APT Targets Israel with New 'MuddyViper' Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian-affiliated APT group MuddyWater has been observed in a new cyberespionage campaign targeting critical infrastructure and other key sectors in Israel and Egypt. Active from late 2024 to early 2025, the campaign leverages a previously undocumented custom C/C++ backdoor named MuddyViper. Th...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus APT's Remote IT Worker Infiltration Scheme Exposed in Real-Time
item.description:
A joint investigation by security researchers has exposed the inner workings of a North Korean Lazarus Group scheme where operatives commit identity fraud to get hired as remote IT workers at Western firms. By luring the threat actors into a sophisticated honeypot environment, researchers from BCA L...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Phishing, Security Operations
